## Monitoring Species Population in Different Habitats

```{r, echo=FALSE}
habitat_A_population <- 320
habitat_B_population <- 275
total_population <- habitat_A_population + habitat_B_population
is_habitat_A_larger <- habitat_A_population > habitat_B_population
population_difference <- habitat_A_population - habitat_B_population

cat("Habitat A population:", habitat_A_population, "\n")
cat("Habitat B population:", habitat_B_population, "\n")
cat("Total population:", total_population, "\n")
cat("Is Habitat A larger than Habitat B?", is_habitat_A_larger, "\n")
cat("Population difference:", population_difference, "\n")
```

## Analyzing Environmental Data for Climate Change Impact

```{r, echo=FALSE}
current_temperature <- 25
predicted_increase <- 3.8
future_temperature <- current_temperature + predicted_increase
current_temperature_F <- (current_temperature * 9/5) + 32
future_temperature_F <- (future_temperature * 9/5) + 32
exceeds_threshold <- future_temperature > 5

cat("Current temperature (C):", current_temperature, "\n")
cat("Predicted increase (C):", predicted_increase, "\n")
cat("Future temperature (C):", future_temperature, "\n")
cat("Current temperature (F):", current_temperature_F, "\n")
cat("Future temperature (F):", future_temperature_F, "\n")
cat("Does future temperature exceed critical threshold?", exceeds_threshold, "\n")
```

## Evaluating Pollutant Levels in a River

```{r, echo=FALSE}
chemical_X_concentration <- 15.3
chemical_Y_concentration <- 9.8

is_chemical_X_safe <- chemical_X_concentration < 10
is_chemical_Y_safe <- chemical_Y_concentration < 10
are_both_safe <- is_chemical_X_safe & is_chemical_Y_safe

cat("Chemical X concentration (ppm):", chemical_X_concentration, "\n")
cat("Chemical Y concentration (ppm):", chemical_Y_concentration, "\n")
cat("Is Chemical X safe?", is_chemical_X_safe, "\n")
cat("Is Chemical Y safe?", is_chemical_Y_safe, "\n")
cat("Are both chemicals safe?", are_both_safe, "\n")
```
